candidates.title: Release v0.12.0 and prepare v0.13.0 development cycle
candidates.body:
## Summary

This PR completes the v0.12.0 release process and prepares the repository for the next v0.13.0 development cycle.

## What's Included

### ✅ v0.12.0 Release Completion
- **Complete pre-release preparation**: All code quality checks, testing, version verification, and documentation updates
- **Comprehensive CHANGELOG**: Added detailed v0.12.0 changelog with all major features, infrastructure improvements, security fixes, and deployment enhancements
- **Release script improvements**: Updated `release.py` with correct dependency order and removed outdated `release.bat`

### ✅ v0.12.0 Already Published & Live 🎉
- **All core Rust crates** published to crates.io v0.12.0
- **Python package** published to PyPI v0.12.0  
- **GitHub release** created: https://github.com/madesroches/micromegas/releases/tag/v0.12.0
- **Git tags** pushed for all releases

### 🔄 v0.13.0 Development Cycle Preparation  
- **Version bumps**: All components updated to v0.13.0
  - Rust workspace and all crate versions
  - Python package version
  - Analytics web app version
  - Updated internal dependency references
- **Lock file updates**: Regenerated Cargo.lock and package-lock.json

## Major v0.12.0 Features Delivered

- **Async span tracing revolution** with new proc macros
- **JSONB support** and **HTTP gateway** integration
- **Perfetto async spans** with SQL-powered trace generation  
- **Complete Python/SQL documentation** with visual diagrams
- **Security fixes** including CVE-2025-58160
- **Cloud deployment tools** and Rust 2024 edition upgrade

## Commits in this PR

- Complete pre-release preparation for v0.12.0
- Update CHANGELOG and release plan with final v0.12.0 details  
- Update release scripts with correct dependency order
- Bump version to 0.13.0 for next development cycle

## Ready for Merge

All release work is complete and the repository is ready for continued development on v0.13.0.

candidates.title: Fix CVE-2025-58160: Update tracing-subscriber to 0.3.20
candidates.body:
## Summary
- Updates tracing-subscriber from 0.3.18 to 0.3.20 to address security vulnerability
- Fixes CVE-2025-58160 / GHSA-xwfj-jgwm-7wp5 (ANSI escape sequence injection)
- Prevents untrusted user input from manipulating terminal output through ANSI escape sequences

## Test plan
- [x] Cargo build successful
- [x] All tests passing
- [x] No breaking changes in API

Fixes #23 (Dependabot security alert)

candidates.title: update datafusion, restore process query builder
Implement Perfetto async spans support with trace generation
candidates.body:
## Summary
- Complete implementation of Perfetto async spans visualization support
- Add streaming writer infrastructure for memory-efficient trace generation  
- Fix timestamp reliability and stream filtering issues in trace generation
- Add comprehensive test coverage and end-to-end validation

## Test plan
- [x] All unit tests pass (perfetto writer, streaming writer, async events)
- [x] Integration tests with real telemetry data validate trace generation
- [x] Generated traces are compatible with Perfetto UI visualization
- [x] Memory usage remains constant for large traces via streaming writer
- [x] Proper filtering of CPU streams eliminates log event processing warnings

candidates.title: Update dependencies to latest compatible versions
candidates.body:
## Summary
Updates key dependencies to their latest compatible versions for improved security, performance, and feature support.

## Changes Made

### ✅ Successfully Updated Dependencies:
- **reqwest**: 0.12.4 → 0.12.23 (security and performance improvements)
- **sqlx**: 0.8.1 → 0.8.6 (bug fixes and PostgreSQL improvements)  
- **colored**: 2.x → 3.0.0 (improved terminal color support)
- **memoffset**: 0.6 → 0.9.1 (performance optimizations)
- **sysinfo**: 0.33 → 0.37.0 (better cross-platform system info)

### ✅ Patch Updates Applied:
- All DataFusion crates: v49.0.0 → v49.0.1
- hyper: 1.6.0 → 1.7.0
- proc-macro2, serde_json, and various other patch updates

### ❌ Updates Attempted but Reverted:
- **arrow-flight**: 55 → 56 (conflicts with DataFusion's Arrow v55 dependency)
- **tonic**: 0.12 → 0.14 (breaking changes - `tls` feature removed)

## Test plan
- [x] Build completes successfully
- [x] All workspace library tests pass
- [x] No compilation errors or warnings
- [x] Dependency conflicts resolved

## Notes
The updates were applied incrementally with build verification after each change. Major version updates that would cause breaking changes or dependency conflicts were properly reverted to maintain stability.

This brings the project's dependencies significantly more up-to-date while maintaining full compatibility.

candidates.title: Add async span depth tracking for performance analysis
candidates.body:
## Summary
- Adds depth field to async span events for tracking execution hierarchy
- Implements comprehensive testing to verify depth tracking accuracy
- Updates documentation with async performance analysis guide

## Changes
- **Schema**: Added `depth` field to async events table and processing
- **Runtime**: Modified span instrumentation to track execution depth via thread-local storage
- **Testing**: Added extensive test coverage for depth tracking across async scenarios
- **Documentation**: Created async performance analysis guide with query patterns

## Test Plan
- [x] Unit tests for depth tracking in various async patterns
- [x] Integration tests with real async workflows
- [x] Verified depth values in SQL queries
- [x] Tested with nested spawns, joins, and selects
- [x] Documentation examples validated

candidates.title: Async events
candidates.body:
## Summary
Complete implementation of async events view for micromegas telemetry system to enable debugging and analysis of async operations across threads.

• **Core async events view** - Process-scoped materialized view aggregating async span events from all thread streams
• **High-frequency optimization** - Minimal 10-field schema optimized for frequent async operations  
• **Timestamp fix** - Proper tick-to-nanosecond conversion resolving 1970 epoch issue
• **Comprehensive testing** - 12 Rust unit tests + 6 Python integration tests with process-based time ranges
• **Development tooling** - Python service management scripts and Jupyter notebook environment

## Key Features
- Cross-thread async operation visibility via `view_instance('async_events', process_id)`
- Parent-child span relationship tracking for nested async operations
- Duration analysis by matching begin/end event pairs
- Process info JOINs for contextual debugging
- Work-stealing scheduler compatibility across thread boundaries

## Test Plan
- [x] All Rust unit tests passing (async events view creation, block processing, high-frequency scenarios)
- [x] Python integration tests with realistic time ranges
- [x] End-to-end validation with telemetry generator
- [x] Service management scripts tested and verified
- [x] Code formatting and build validation

candidates.title: Add comprehensive async tracing infrastructure with micromegas_main proc macro
candidates.body:
## Summary

• **micromegas_main proc macro**: Drop-in replacement for `#[tokio::main]` with automatic telemetry setup and tracing callbacks
• **Async span instrumentation**: Full support for async functions in `#[span_fn]` macro with `InstrumentedFuture` wrapper
• **Thread lifecycle management**: Proper thread stream registration/unregistration with tokio runtime integration  
• **Service migration**: All services now use `micromegas_main` for consistent telemetry configuration

## Key Features

- **Safe async tracing**: Uses `pin-project` for memory-safe future instrumentation
- **Thread safety**: Comprehensive concurrent access protection with proper cleanup on thread destruction  
- **Runtime integration**: `TracingRuntimeExt` trait for seamless tokio runtime configuration
- **Level overrides**: Configurable logging levels via proc macro parameters
- **Memory testing**: In-memory sink for reliable test verification without I/O dependencies

## Migration Impact

Services migrated from manual `TelemetryGuardBuilder` setup to `#[micromegas_main]`:
- `flight-sql-srv`
- `http-gateway` 
- `telemetry-admin-cli`
- `telemetry-ingestion-srv`

## Test Plan

- [x] Async span macro tests with event count verification
- [x] Sync span macro functionality preserved  
- [x] Thread safety tests under high concurrency
- [x] Thread parking flush behavior validation
- [x] Service integration with new proc macro
- [x] Memory leak prevention via proper stream unregistration

candidates.title: use the official jsonb since the change was integrated
removing the pg gateway and support for pg catalog
candidates.body: while the postgresql wire protocol works fine, true interop would require real support for queries into the pg_catalog tables

candidates.title: replace custom interning logic with crate internment
register pg_catalog under its own schema
use fork of jsonb to better manage dependencies
feat: Update Rust edition to 2024 and fix unsafe operations
docs: Add and improve Rust documentation
candidates.body:
This commit addresses several documentation issues:
- Added comprehensive documentation to previously undocumented public structs and functions across various Rust crates.
- Corrected misplaced doc comments to ensure they are properly associated with their respective items.
- Attempted to fix unclosed HTML tags in . While some were fixed, others remain due to the file being auto-generated and the source  files being unavailable.
- Acknowledged the  crate filename collision as a known Cargo bug that cannot be fixed at the code level.

These changes were generated by Gemini.

candidates.title: pg-catalog feature
candidates.body: Disabled by default - not enough to allow powerbi to connect using its postgresql support.

chosen_pr.title: Release v0.12.0 and prepare v0.13.0 development cycle
chosen_pr.body:
## Summary

This PR completes the v0.12.0 release process and prepares the repository for the next v0.13.0 development cycle.

## What's Included

### ✅ v0.12.0 Already Published & Live 🎉

  - Rust workspace and all crate versions
  - Python package version
  - Analytics web app version

## Major v0.12.0 Features Delivered

- **Async span tracing revolution** with new proc macros
- **JSONB support** and **HTTP gateway** integration
